Clear a variable slot.

Description:

_FC_VarSlot* _fc_getNewVarSlot ( void   ) 

Get an empty variable slot from the variable table.

Description:

Will return a new slot or NULL. A NULL means a memory error occurred.

FC_ReturnCode _fc_getNextComponentExtension ( unsigned int *  state,
unsigned int *  lastCompInGuess,
unsigned int *  lastCompInSearch,
char *  extension 
)

Get a common component extension for combining vars.

Description:

This function is used when searching for single-component vars/seqVars that should be combined into a multicomponent var/seqVar. This function holds a table of common extensions and is designed to generate several permutations of the extension format to make guessing the component names easier. A state variable is passed to the function in order to keep track of where the search is. The idea is that a user keeps calling this function until a good match is found or the function runs out of guesses.

This function produces one component extension at a time, sequentially (ie, for the first extension guess, it gives _x, _y, and then _z). The lastCompInGuess variable indicates that the result is the last component of a particular extension. The lastCompInSearch indicates that the result is the last component of the last possible guess.

The user can find out info about the guesses by passing NULL into state. In this case, lastCompInGuess returns the maximum number of characters in an individual extension, while lastCompInSearch returns the largest number of components a guess can have.

Modifications:

  • 12/12/2007 CDU Created.
Parameters:
state  input - state information retained between calls
lastCompInGuess  output - flag indicating this is the last component of a guess
lastCompInSearch  output - flag indicating this is the last component of last guess
extension  input - pre-allocated array where extension is written

Referenced by fc_getSeqVariableComponentsByName(), and fc_getVariableComponentsByName().

06733   // - Update num_rows to reflect number of different extension patterns
06734   // - Update num_cols to reflect max number of components in a pattern
06735   // - Update max_ext_len if your extension symbols become longer
06736   // - Insert longer vectors first: Make sure tuvw comes before
06737   //    tuv so longer number of components are found first
06738   const unsigned int num_rows    = 6; //How many rows in table below
06739   const unsigned int num_cols    = 4; //How many columns in table below

06741   const unsigned int max_ext_len = 2+2+1; //underscores + extension + \0
06742

06744                     {"x",  "y",  NULL, NULL },
06745                     {"c0", "c1", "c2", "c3" },
06746                     {"c0", "c1", "c2", NULL },
06747                     {"t",  "u",  "v",  "w"  },

06754 
06755 
06756   //Always must have at least these two return pointers
06757   if((!lastCompInGuess)||(!lastCompInSearch)){
06758     fc_printfErrorMessage("Null variable in input");
06759     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06760   }
06761   
06762   //When user passes NULL in for state, they're actually querying to
06763   //see what the dimensions of the table are. Just pass these back
06764   if(!state){
06765     *lastCompInGuess  = max_ext_len;
06766     *lastCompInSearch = num_cols;
06767     return FC_SUCCESS;
06768   }
06769 
06770   //Unpack the state
06771   col   = (*state>> 0) & 0x0FF;
06772   row   = (*state>> 8) & 0x0FF;
06773   round = (*state>>16) & 0x0FF;
06774   
06775   //printf("Working on round/row/col : %d/%d/%d\n", round, row, col);
06776   
06777   //Check bounds
06778   if( (round >= num_rounds) || (row >= num_rows) || (col >= num_cols) || 
06779       (!vector_endings[row][col])){
06780     fc_printfErrorMessage("Input boundary check failure");
06781     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06782   }
06783 
06784 
06785   //The user may not want to actually retrieve the extension. They may
06786   //just be looping through the components in a row because one of the
06787   //components wasn't found.
06788   if(extension){
06789 
06790     switch(round){
06791     case 0: underscore="_";  upper=0; break;
06792     case 1: underscore="_";  upper=1; break;
06793     case 2: underscore="__"; upper=0; break;
06794     case 3: underscore="__"; upper=1; break;
06795     case 4: underscore="";   upper=1; break;
06796     case 5: underscore="";   upper=0; break;
06797     default:
06798       fc_printfErrorMessage("Bad case statement?");
06799       return FC_ERROR;
06800     }
06801     
06802     snprintf(extension, max_ext_len, "%s%s",underscore,vector_endings[row][col]);
06803     if(upper){ //Convert to uppercase
06804       s=extension;
06805       while(*s!='\0'){
06806      *s = toupper(*s);
06807      s++;
06808       }
06809     }
06810   }
06811 
06812   //Done with this entry: Update the state
06813   col++;
06814   *lastCompInGuess=0;
06815   *lastCompInSearch=0;
06816   if((col==num_cols) || (!vector_endings[row][col])){
06817     //End of column
06818     *lastCompInGuess=1;
06819     col=0;
06820     row++;
06821     if(row==num_rows){
06822       //End of rows
06823       row=0;
06824       round++;
06825       if(round==num_rounds){
06826      //End of search
06827      *lastCompInSearch=1;
06828       }
06829     }
06830   }
06831 
06832   //Pack the state again
06833   *state = (round<<16) | (row<<8) | (col);
06834 
06835   return FC_SUCCESS;
06836 }

_FC_VarSlot* _fc_getVarSlot ( FC_Variable  variable  ) 

Get a variable slot from a variable handle.

Description:

The slot id of the variable handle is used to find the the slot in the variable table. The identity is then verified by checking that the slot and the handle's uIDs are the same. On success, a pointer to the slot is returned. Otherwise a NULL pointer is returned.

Modifications:

  • 2003-OCT-19 WSK Created to replace using _fc_checkhandle and GET_ID for better type checking (using pointer's to slots is less bug prone than lot's of xxxTable[xxxID] references).
  • 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_isHandleValid common to all tables.
Parameters:
variable  input - variable

_FC_VarSlot* _fc_getVarSlotFromID ( int  varID  ) 

Get a variable slot based on ID.

Description:

The _FC_VarSlot at the requested slotID is returned. This should only be used when you really know that it is the slot you want because there is no checking of the uID like with _fc_getVarSlot. The only checking is that the slotID is exists in the table and that the uID is > 0 (i.e. it is not empty).

Modifications:

  • 11/27/03 WSK Created so that external routines can index into tables without knowing about them.
  • 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_getSlot() common to all tables.

Definition at line 6565 of file variable.c.

References _fc_getSlot(), and varTableSize.

void _fc_printVarTable ( char *  label  ) 

Print the contents of the Variable Table (varTable) to stderr.

Description:

Prints the contents of the Variable Table in a human readable form. It takes a string to use as a label for this print out of the table. Pass NULL if you don't want a label.

Modifications:

  • Nancy Collins Created.
  • 2003-NOV-13 WSK Fixed up.
Parameters:
label  Input - label for this version the table (without a trailing \n) pass NULL if no label is desired
